website_summaries.verdict: The SwissGear can perform equally well as a backpack or carry on bag. We like the number and size of its external pockets.Versatile enough to be a book bag during the week and a travel backpack on weekends.
pros: Lies flat for easier airport security processing
Generous supply of external pockets for paperwork and electronics
cons: Straps and zippers have durability issues
Side-opening pocket for laptop not ideal for safe handling

customer_reviews.title: Both of our teens love this backpack
customer_reviews.text: Both of our teens love this backpack. Unfortunately, the zipper broke on one. We wrote to Swiss Army because it was only 1 year old and under warranty. Unfortunately they did not respond, so we just bought another. It's roomy and works very well for a student in high school or college. We do have another that has not broken , so hoping it will not happen again. UPDATE ON 2ND PURCHASE: Sadly, same thing happened, but his time after only 2 months. Will not buy this product again. And, hoping the manufacturer will honor their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn B.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: Two bags ripped. The warranty process is a joke and their partners are worthless. Not worth spending anymore time or money with this company. Putting these in the trash where they belong. Recommend searching online for sturdy bags with companies who actually stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great Swiss knife quality, old design that wastes space
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. My 3rd swiss gear laptop bag. They really last and are well designed. This particular bag was ordered by my daughter. Had I been more involved I would have steered her away from this design. This bag has the zipper that allows the bag to lay flat, the premise being that you can unzip open it fully in half and pass TSA screening with the laptop left in the bag. Doesn't work that way anymore. Laptops have to be completely removed. This wastes the entire center of the bag. My other 2 bags are standard and have that extra center compartment. Otherwise a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: Bobcat

customer_reviews.title: Works OK. Definitely not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: The backpack does and is what it indicates in the description and I am generally happy with it. I have a few issues though: 1. The laptop compartment is the compartment closest to your back. I'd prefer it were more in the middle to provide more protection. 2. The zipper for the laptop compartment only goes around half way (from the top to the bottom on one side). You have to slide the laptopn in sideways. 3. This backpack is not anywhere close to being water repellent, waterproof or any form of water resistance. I got caught in a rain storm and a book and a pad inside were soaked.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry M.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for my son!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my son who travels frequently. I did my research and this back pack was in the top 3 for business travel. It is made of quality materials and came as advertised. My son took it on a trip last week and said the handle was very sturdy and made getting through security so much better. His laptop and other other items he needs fit perfectly inside. I purchased the black and blue one which is the color of his college football team which made special for him. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Media Pocket Missing (see screenshot and photos)
customer_reviews.text: One of the features I was most looking forward to, the "media pocket" that's supposed to be in the compartment where the headphone hole leads into, the main compartment, was completely missing. I thought maybe I was looking in the wrong place and searched every compartment, but the media pocket was nowhere to be found, so I have initiated a return. Very disappointed and unexpected from a name like Swiss Gear. I really want this backpack, but am afraid to reorder it because I don't want to hassle with another return, if I were to get another defective one. (see screenshot and photos)
customer_reviews.author: Bob C.

customer_reviews.title: A great backpack, priced reasonably
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Swiss Gear backpack in about ten years. I've had many backpacks in my day. The Swiss gear packs are the best I have seen. I don't actually carry a laptop in the pack. I do carry books and printed matter in it. It is made well with beefy zippers and thick cloth. These packs stand up to hard use. I like how it stands up vertical when you set it down. It has a lot of compartments for items. It is reasonably priced. It is better than packs I've had at more than twice the price. I recommend this pack
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Not TSA Friendly
customer_reviews.text: I was still required to pull out my Gaming Laptop and other electronic devices into seperate scanning bins. I guess this would be great for TSA Pre Check Passangers, but not for the average airline passanger. I was able to fit AKG Wireless Bluetooth Headphones, External Battery Pack Charger, Power Brick, Mouse and other accessories. In addition, I was able to fit a college text book. There is plenty of room for most of your possessions and it fit snuggly as a carry on underneath the airline seat. The quality holds up well, but expect to see some loose threading after heavy use. Overall I would recommend this to any college student or businessman that is always on the go.
customer_reviews.author: SierraTheWolfe

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great protection.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a while, used it somewhat infrequently, only for travelling. Recently used it to take my laptop to a friends house. Had it packed up and sitting on the kitchen table when the table was bumped and the backpack fell off on it hard on the floor. Pulled my laptop out and it started up with no issues, not even a mark/dent anywhere. Very pleased and I'll be using the bag more often now.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag! Well Engineered and constructed. I use it daily and have it on my back for my 8 hours shifts in the Florida sun. I wash it weekly in the washing machine and no discoloration yet. Very comfortable, lots of pockets for my stuff and lots of space for my work tablets. I have to go through security checks daily and having it open to show the electronics is so smart. Good money spent good product recieved. I am very impressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: GREAT backpack - but shoulder straps too wide for women
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wanted to keep this backpack. It has everything you need: multiple pockets, good-sized water bottle holders, a padded back zip pocket that holds your laptop and folds flat for travel. It looks well constructed and is just a darned good-looking backpack. HOWEVER - I am 5'3" -- short but on the wide-shouldered side for a woman. And yet these straps are far too wide for me. They dig into the sides of my armpits in front, such that with a laptop inside, it's painful to reach forward with my arms. Please, Swiss Gear, make some flex-adjustable shoulder straps or differently-shaped straps (see North Face Borealis for an example) that better fit women!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit 17" laptops
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how they came to the conclusion of "laptop compartment" of being 17" X 12.5" X 2.5" because that doesn't work for rectangular laptops - width goes down to under 11" near the top of the 17", so unless your laptop is missing corners or significantly smaller than 17", it won't fit inside the laptop compartment Also came with annoying plastic covering the logos on the straps which was sewn into the straps, making it a PITA to remove. Would NOT recommend - if you need at 17" laptop bag, get something else, and if you don't need a 17" laptop bag, also get something else
customer_reviews.author: slapshot136

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad. I was expecting a thicker material, but it seems pretty good. Since I read in some reviews that the back zipper can get opened on the weight, I put an extra carabiner to keep it closed, but no problems until now. The one thing I find annoying is that it tends to fall to the front when you put it on any solid horizontal surface. I would expect it to remain stable, or to fall to the back. Now, one thing: TSA does not cares about it being TSA friendly - you still have to take the laptop away. So... there it goes the main advantage for what I got this backpack...
customer_reviews.author: Jean Lostaunau

customer_reviews.title: Worst Swiss Gear bag design I have seen.  More room in my simple 15" Swiss Gear Bag.
customer_reviews.text: The way this bag is laid out makes it hold a laptop and nothing else. It does the fancy fold out for security but I find it to be way more of a PITA than just pulling the laptop out by itself. All the space is wasted inside because of the 69 organizers like the Taurus bag. They both suck compared to my bugout bag that I have had for 10 years. That bag has seen to many deployments and needs to be replaced. I finally just bought another one cause these bags sucked.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great traveling backpack
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through a significant amount of bags in my travels around the world. I always come back to a backpack ad the most convenient vehicle for hauling my junk with me. This backpack had a lot of well thought out nooks and crannies to hold my portable office plus snacks. What else could a traveling journalist require? The only downside I've noticed is three fabric seems thin. I'll see how it holds up over time I suppose. Oh, yeah, I do tend to lose a lot of crumbs from my snacks in the various nooks and crannies.
customer_reviews.author: Carl West

customer_reviews.title: enough room
customer_reviews.text: The size of the backpack is good to carry a lot of things, however, the compartments were designed in a convenient way. If you wan to use it for school, most of the weight carries in the front part of the backpack you it will tilt to the front. It can be rally annoying but you are able to fit a lot of notebooks and books. If it is for travel the inside big compartment has a diver that to me is completely unnecessary, it limits what you can put inside. I guess you can push it to the back and you'll be okay but is does get in the way. I do love the laptop compartment for quick access.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Travel Backpack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack after much research on travel backpacks and it was perfect! My son recently traveled to Africa and he said this backpack with all the compartments could not have been more perfect for his needs, and helped keep him organized. There is a nice hideaway spot for passport and money; another for headphones and cell phone; and a separate compartment where he was even able to put 2 changes of clothes for the long journey without having to dig through it to get to other things. Also, nice outside compartments for water bottles. It really has EVERYTHING.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa J. Rief

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and lots of storage space
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who travels a lot for work and he absolutely loves it. The laptop compartment and all of the room for the countless gadgets he needs to carry it has room for and then some. The easy access to show all electronic items when going threw airport security is a great feature. He says its comfortable and durable, has already said he wants another when this one wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Juliette G

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality and / or Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag in 2017 and have not used it much as I no longer need to commute far having managed to work from home. However I am not at all satisfied with this backpack as the mesh cloth on the bottom outside of the bag is separating at the seam. The bag was stored inside in a dry place and so there was no dry rot. This is totally unacceptable and having read other reviews indicating their warranties are a joke I have no choice but to take my business elsewhere. I myself being Swiss am ashamed to see that stamped on the bag. Had high expectations and instead was disappointed. Quality is just not there!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Huwyler

customer_reviews.title: zippers are subpar
customer_reviews.text: I am, admittedly, hard on backpacks and purses...however, I have had multiple backpacks under $40 that lasted MUCH longer than this bag. After 3 years, without traveling with this bag - only commuting to/from work - the main compartment zipper broke...making the bag completely useless. I have always liked swissgear products but the last 2 products I have purchased from this company in the past 5-years have lacked the durability with which I was accustomed from this company. I would be hesitant to purchase anything else from them unless you find an amazing deal (ex. ~$40 for a backpack). Otherwise, stick with Mountain Hardware, Northface or even Jansport.
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: Good for someone, but be careful about knockoffs.
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time even giving this 2 stars and tried to come up with a good reason. The description promises many things but the pack, as a whole, simply doesn't live up to it. The shoulders are uncomfortable, it feels cheap and a bit like cardboard, just all around uncomfortable. It also seems to be lacking in features that were described. (which when I have time will come back and point out). It and another pack I ordered really just seem to be knock-offs of the brand. Further, even though I thought I was ordering two different packs to try out, they are nearly identical. (SwissGear 2762 ScanSmart Laptop Backpack.) I would be careful on this one.
customer_reviews.author: P. R. Ecker

customer_reviews.title: Built to Last
customer_reviews.text: This bag was to replace a Swiss Gear backpack that I have used daily, abused for over 15 years, so naturally we went back to the brand that is built to last. This back pack is just the same quality as the original. Love the pockets, a place to my phone with headphone access, a place for my tablet and well as a 17" laptop. Of course, an overload of school books in the bag as well. I ride a bicycle 4 miles each way as well as have to walk an additional mile to my destination and the pack fits well and rides well on my back
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang K Brueggemann

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing. Best backpack I’ve ever had and I’m 34! Going to college, single mom with back trouble. This has been incredibly helpful and I’ve just been using it for. Few days. The weight distribution is great! Lots of padding. Just a great backpack. All the pockets are awesome. I love to be organized so this helps! Update - this backpack arrived on 9/28/19. It is now 10/15/19. I heard a tear in a week when I put it on my back this morning. I’m concerned it’s not capable of holding my books. This is concerning to me as I am a pre-nursing student. We will see how it goes...
customer_reviews.author: M. S. Tenneson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gadgets
customer_reviews.text: This backpack feels heavy and stiff. Which is good if you're hauling a laptop, chargers, and other gadgets. Really it's pretty light given how much has been added to protect your gear. I've been using the same JanSport backpack for 15 years and I love it - but that old design sucks for packing a bunch of electronics. I don't always carry my laptop with me, but when I do I'll use this SwissGear 1900.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this backpack as a present for my son ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this backpack as a present for my son. When he received it, the top of the bag was ripped, and it had somebody's homework inside. Completely unacceptable. When you buy this product, you must be careful, because you might be purchasing a used item sold to you as if it were new.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Swiss Gear makes a great line of products overall. I use and abuse mine because of my line of work. They’re packed and heavy and I carry my bag every day in and out of locations I work at. They sit on cold, dirty retail floors and still hold up well. They clean off well too. I have no complaints. The design is great, the organization in the different pockets is awesome and the versatility of the pockets for different things is there, the zippers have never failed me, and it looks fantastic so I’m super happy... it’s just a great line of products and I’m a big fan. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Kymberlei

customer_reviews.title: Scansmart?  Nope! Still had to remove on first and only travel
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great bag. It’s a big bag, overkill for the businesspeople with laoptops smaller than 15”. Good pockets, though I’d love to suggest some improvements. Overall a very good bag BUT .... It’s advertised as “Scansmart” and a great concept; however, first and only trip with bag NOPE, you’ve got to remove laptop from bag thus my security check hit a bump drawing looks from everyone thinking I was crazy when I said, “but it’s sold as TSA approved”. Not in ATL. GREAT backpack just be sure to remove your laptop like with all other backpacks. The marketing sold me.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Awesome organizational backpack
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this backpack!!! So many pockets to cram my numerous textbooks, binders, and so on. I don't travel, but the TSA thing is nice because I am planning to do so at a later date. Really sleek and modern design, too. As with everything, be cautious stuffing too much into this, particularly since... this design has NO WAIST STRAP. That's important because waist straps enable you to balance weight more efficiently against your body and back than shoulder straps alone do. So, don't go crazy with filling this. I really like the straps on the water bottle pockets, great for keeping larger bottles safely stowed. The numerous pockets and compartments are FABULOUS for organizing all your crap.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla G

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Solid Backpack
customer_reviews.text: The strap for the laptop doesn't stay stuck to the side, that is my only complaint. The floating pocket is perfect for my Samsung tablet, and the pocket in that area fits notebooks or sketchbooks and keeps them nice and flat. The front-most pocket has weird spacers that are open on the bottom, so it's not great for keeping smaller items separated. I don't really understand the purpose of the open bottoms. I was able to carry travel supplies for a two night stay at a hotel along with my laptop and sketchbooks and everything I normally carry to work every day. So far it's been solid and comfortable even when heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Difyance

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in perfect condition, solid design, lots of space
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect condition exactly as expected. It is a big bag with many pockets, so I would not recommend it for traveling unless it is used specifically for business equipment. It is a great design for those who like to keep things organized. 2 pockets for water bottles, pocket for pens and such in front, pocket for folders and such in the middle with dividers, and you can fit good sized laptop with a tablet in the back. It has a good amount of space and I still have room for more if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Walker

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Holds a Ton!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this backpack! Held all my study books for the LSAT and had room for my laptop and my iPad. It fit under the seat in front of me and in the overhead. If you stuff it so full the zippers have a hard time closing it will not fit under the seat. Also, you WILL HAVE TO take your iPad and laptop out of the backpack at airport security.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: ScanSmart is great for TSA
customer_reviews.text: The ScanSmart feature works well if you frequently travel by air and must endure TSA checkpoints. For ordinary commuting, I do not think ScanSmart provides enough protection for the laptop due to relatively thin padding around the computer compartment. This bag provides lots of annoying hooks, latches, and loops with obscure purposes. They get caught on stuff. Swiss Gear is substituting bogus "features" of questionable value (like water bottle straps) instead of building a simple, durable pack that provides adequate protection for the contents.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio Largo

customer_reviews.title: More backpack than I need
customer_reviews.text: The backpack is well made and attractively designed. I ordered this backpack and returned it because it was bigger than I thought it would be and had waaaaaay too many compartments and zippers. In the product photo they have all the zipper pulls laying neatly along the zippers and that camouflages them giving the bag a cleaner look. When I saw the backpack for myself it had zipper pulls jangling all over the place. I could picture myself traveling with it and repeatedly zipping and unzipping all those compartments because I couldn't remember where I put something. Not for me, but a quality product just the same.
customer_reviews.author: Cyntha H

customer_reviews.title: Jingle bells, Jingle bells
customer_reviews.text: Do you hear that sound? That's the sound of me walking with this backpack on. It sounds like Santa's blessed sleigh and eight tiny reindeer. Jingle, jingle jingle etc. The zipper tabs are mostly metal, and there are many of them, and they all clank around like jingle bells. People can hear me coming from 100 yards away, which makes it hard to sneek into those business meetings: Meeting: "For our next item of business..." Me: "Jingle, jingle, jingle, jingle..." [runs into the meeting late] Meeting: [silence, stares] Otherwise the backpack is awesome, lots of storage, durable, and highly recommended. I think I'll put some tape around the zipper tabs to quiet them down.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Brown

customer_reviews.title: What I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for an upcoming trip. I was looking for a computer backpack to carry my laptop plus accessories, and some clothes. My laptop fit in the back compartment design for it. The middle compartment is big enough for accessories and some clothes. The front pocket is perfect for miscellaneous items and the side pockets for snacks/small water bottles. I am carrying another backpack for clothes only and should be able to carry both inside the plane because it meet TSA requirements and airliners rules.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I like this bag. It's big enough to place all I need and more. I love that it has plenty of pockets for storage. It's sturdiness and comfort it's ideal for travel. I love the zipper and the zipper handles strong and heavy duty. However, the balance is off. When you place it down it always falls forward it does not stand erect.
customer_reviews.author: E. Rod

customer_reviews.title: This was a great decision
customer_reviews.text: I looked through a variety of backpacks and satchels before landing on the SwissGear brand and this bag. I have loved the bag so far. It distributes weight well, seems very durable, and has made getting my laptop and supplies in and out easy and fast. I feel it keeps my content safe and secure and has more room than I need. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Simon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for traveling, very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my husband when his computer case came apart. It is sturdy (my husband loads it with TONS of weight- 2 computers, books, tools, you name it) and it's held up for nearly 2 years now. I ended up buying a second one (different color) for my son to use for school. He loves it- holds all of his binders, his computer, and his music. My husband want a second one that he can set aside specifically for travel so he doesn't have to clean out his current one, and my 2nd and 3rd sons want one as well! Wonderful bag, we are very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Mel B Bad

customer_reviews.title: my last swiss back pack lasted over 10 years
customer_reviews.text: and i used it everyday. normal wear and tear occurred but i figured it was time for a new one. the zippers feel better on the new ones. easier to open. and they seem bigger. the only two things i do not like about the design is the little divider flaps that are in the main pocket. if i had books and folders then i would use them. but since i dont. they just get in the way. also you almost cant keep anything in the front top pocket or else the back pack will tip over. other than that. i love this back pack
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this bag! I bought this when my old Swiss bag of 14 years ripped. This bag is durable I used it while going to an extension program and took this to Thailand with me. It has the perfect storage space for glasses in a case, cell phone or power bank, iPad and a MacBook laptop. I recommend this bag for those that tend to travel or are going to School. I don't know how this will work if you are a serious backpacker but if you are someone like me a designer or a programmer that tends to travel cafe to cafe then this is a great option!
customer_reviews.author: Kennedy DeSousa

customer_reviews.title: Useless Stitching came undone
customer_reviews.text: So, there's this stitching on one of the shoulder straps, and it doesn't serve any actual purpose. It's just decorative. Well that stitching totally failed. The rest of the pack has been good so far. I like the TSA fold open feature. But, you can't use the Tablet pouch at the Airport, because it obscures the rest of the pack and they make you run it through again. At least I didn't get a full cavity search or anything. THAT would have been embarrassing! But the pack works well otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Smiley

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months with this bag, it appears well made and is holding up. That being said, I'm going to have to get rid of it. Due to the design of the pockets and zippers, I'm continuously experiencing the contents of my bag spilling out when I pick it up. Unless the pockets are zipped fairly closed, the weight of contents can pull the zipper open. As an example, I was walking on campus, wearing my bag, and all of a sudden my laptop falls out and hits the concrete. Apparently I did not zip it completely closed and after walking some distance the zipper gradually pulled open more and more.
customer_reviews.author: MEB

customer_reviews.title: Best backpack I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a backpack that was flexible enough to carry on, but would handle my electronics (laptop, tablet, etc.), a change of clothing and toiletries and misc travel stuff. This meets and exceeds all of my requirements. The fabric is tough but looks nice and the zippers are heavy duty. One of the best features is that the middle large section completely unzips and folds flat so that you can easily access your computers, or clothing if you use it for that. The back of the pack is nicely padded as well as the straps and is the most comfortable backpack I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Snoopy1

customer_reviews.title: BEST BAG I'VE EVER HAD! Super high quality!
customer_reviews.text: After almost a year, this backpack has still done it's job and more! It's such a blessing to have; and it's just so durable, versatile, comfortable, lightweight, and good looking (haha)! I highly, highly recommend buying this bag. You get more than your money's worth, and there's a 3 year fix warranty that comes with it! What a deal!!! God bless, and God matters more!
customer_reviews.author: Christian A Harrison - godmattersmore

customer_reviews.title: Not for young students
customer_reviews.text: I have a bag like this work, different model. It works fine for me, so that's why I bought this one for my son for school, 7th grade. Got it end of Nov 2018 & school finished May 2019, with 4 weeks off in there, so 5 months of use. The mesh pockets have tears in both sides from using stainless steel water bottles, then the seam on one edge of the zipper split, making difficult to open/close. And then one side of one of the zippers popped off. So now it's useless. Less than 6 months of use. Dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: marco

customer_reviews.title: Too small and poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: This pack is very small and not as described and pictured in description. It's a shame that all we have to choose from as consumers now is poor quality, mass produced products from a certain nation that sports the highest population and we are currently in a trade battle with. Not that I approve of the latter. Just sayin', everything these days is made so poorly. It's to the point where I don't want to shop online from this retailer any longer. I think I'll go back to brick and mortar.
customer_reviews.author: Dose Of Reality

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I had spent $60 on a backpack in Oct 2019 it was defective. I started using it early December 2019 and noticed it was frayed by the zipper. I contacted Swiss Gear on multiple times starting on Dec 26th 2019, sending all the pictures they requested. Their response was not to respond for a week at a time, and when they did only to tell me to send pictures before they could help me - no one to call or chat with. This went on for 4 weeks. Originally I loved this backpack but the Customer Service Swiss GearI had provided was the worst I have ever experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Bag for Work & Travel
customer_reviews.text: I use this backpack to carry my work laptop to and from the office everyday. After over a year of use, the backpack still looks like it is new out of the bag. The compartments are all easily accessible and roomy enough to store multiple items in - I can even fit my entire purse into one of the zipper sections. I would definitely recommend this backpack for both work & travel.
customer_reviews.author: PA_is_Great

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, style, features at a fair price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this originally for a cruise I was taking. Liked it so much it is now my everyday to the office backpack! Has been used heavily for 2+ months without a sign of wear. It is incredibly well made, has plenty of small, medium and large pockets with easy access! Super easy going through security check points, and looks great! I got the red and black, and it fits my 17" laptop perfectly while giving it plenty of cushion for the occasional bump or bang. I would highly recommend this product and seller! I have paid a lot more for "name brand" packs that were not made this well!
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

customer_reviews.title: Packs sick
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I get harassed at TSA and pretty much everywhere there’s a rent a pig buster wanna be cop. I have hella tattoos and im punk af. But this pack helped with those whack foos at tsa trippin on my iPad or Nintendo switch, just bein able to unzip that middle zipper to have the electronics exposed for them. Simple innovation but brilliantly executed
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Balderrama

customer_reviews.title: A good backpack for the price.
customer_reviews.text: A nice designed backpack for the price. Although, this 31L's main compartment can fit 4 large college textbooks (Bio, Chemistry, Physics), I would not put that many textbooks in at one time. In my opinion, the fabric cannot handle them. Anything less heavy, this is ideal to have. This is a nice looking backpack for office and school and doesn't look like I am going camping or hiking. If you are in a high precipitation part of the country, forgo this backpack because it has holes on the side pockets (see the picture). Either way, I bought a $7 30-40L rain cover with this backpack and tuck it in one of the side pockets just in case it rains heavily.
customer_reviews.author: Northern Sky

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Hold Up
customer_reviews.text: We got this backpack for my husband who travels frequently for his job, mostly flying. Within a short period, a section of the zipper for the main compartment pulled Away from the fabric and I had to take it to a tailor to have it fixed. I contacted Swiss and they sent us a check for $20 when the fix costed $25. Now, just 2 1/2 years later, another large part of the zipper has come apart. I remember this company being known for the quality and durability of their products but based on this experience, I can’t say that their products still hold up to the sane standards.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Native

customer_reviews.title: Scoot through security with this well designed backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack for those who travel. I love the smartscan feature as I always hated being that guy who had to drag his laptop out at security and use multiple bins just to get through. Now all it takes is two zippers, lay it flat and I'm waltzing through without a problem. This backpack has a ton of room as well. Multiple pockets for all your gadgets, large roomy area for larger accessories, maybe even clothes for an overnight stay. Just a excellent, well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Superdad

customer_reviews.title: Strong, sturdy, great looking backpack
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my high schooler who has already gone through two backpacks this year. He carries everything in his backpack vice utilizing his locker - whatever. So, I needed to ensure that I got him a very strong, sturdy - yet great looking backpack and this definitely fit the bill. Arrived on time and in great condition and he still hasn't been able to do any damage. Hopefully he'll still be using it this fall. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Staten

customer_reviews.title: Functional Pack, enormous space, small pouches could really use some velcro or zippers.
customer_reviews.text: A very functional backpack. Pros:enough room for two laptops, a tablet, two full sized metal water bottles (zipped up). Comfortable, great handle. Cons: Flimsy when unzipped. Seems there aren't enough small pouches. A few zippers on the small pouches that do exist would help. When you lay the pack down and open the lower compartment, the small items are floating around instead of secured.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Good quality material and zippers, lots of room
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: So If you travel with this and end up having to run to your connecting flight between gates because of delayed flights (like at DFW), just know that the zippers on this bag will slip even mildly packed. The easy zip TSA section really does open quite easily, when you least want it to, as well as the other big pouches. Knocked it down from a 5 star to 3.5. Lots of pockets, and great durable zippers that don't feel cheap or weak. Easily the perfect backpack for an overnight trip with some work equipment to take as well. Straps are also really comfortable and while wearing on your back, it doesn't feel unbalanced.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph N

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but major flaw makes it frustrating to use
customer_reviews.text: As for as quality, this backpack is hard to beat. But one major flaw makes mess wish I had chosen another. When you sit the backpack on the floor it falls forward, even when you lean it against something. This is due to padding in the back. While this makes it comfortable to wear, it is to long and makes the backpack fall forward. Unfortunately this makes using this backpack frustrating and in some cases and damage something in the front pockets.
customer_reviews.author: CS Programmer

customer_reviews.title: I purchased a slim lunch bag that fits perfect into the front large storage area and still allows ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I am loving it, I have been through 3 packs in the past year trying to find one that can be an all-in-on for me, hold my work devices, gym clothes, and lunch bag so I don't have to carry multiple bags.. I purchased a slim lunch bag that fits perfect into the front large storage area and still allows room for my shoes and gym clothes, the laptop and tablet area are great for my work devices.. I am traveling this summer and I believe this will fit the bill for being my second carryon and allow me to take all my devices, and toiletries without needing to check a suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel backpack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my shoulder kills me when I'm traveling and carrying a one shoulder bag. This backpack is super high quality. The zippers are strong and built to last. The back pocket is perfect to hold a laptop or tablet and is well-padded and provides excellent protection. There's a ton of zippered pocket containers for small items that need to be easily accessible. The shoulder straps are well padded and I had absolutely no pain in my shoulder and could carry this thing around comfortably for a long time. Definitely so happy I bought this bag!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie H.

customer_reviews.title: SwissGar Did it again! Another great product.
customer_reviews.text: I really love this bag. I have a very large 17 inch laptop and my original SwissGear backpack I got a few years ago did not fit it. Getting this one was a dream. Its more roomy for my laptop and its snug. The new design is great and they did a great job improving this product over the one I had before. It just feels nice when you have your laptop in it as well as your other accessories and I especially love the deep pockets for carrying extra tall water bottles. You couldn't ask for a better backpack. You can tell SwissGear puts a lot of effort and research designing these backpacks.
customer_reviews.author: MrYon

customer_reviews.title: This is My Go To Travel Backpack
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd SwissGear backpack and love it. The 1st one just wore out after many years of use and travel. This one has plenty of space, fit's a 17.3 " laptop with all the accessories and has room for more. There are many pockets, both internally and externally to hold everything from water bottles to tablets to whatever you can fit. Couldn't have asked for a better bag. Definitely worth the money. The 1st one lasted almost 8 years and went all over the US. Hopefully this one lasts as long. It's off to good start.
customer_reviews.author: Whatnobeer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t stay upright
customer_reviews.text: Had a Wenger Synergy but opted for a new bag thinking this would be better. Same quality but big difference is this bad doesn’t stay upright it always falls faceforward when you put it down. Also to note the laptop zipper is only zips on one side the bag (it side loads) not a big deal but once again you can’t rummage through it without holding it up. Synergy is by far superior
customer_reviews.author: St. Louie

customer_reviews.title: Great tsa friendly backpack
customer_reviews.text: This backpack has a lot of room. I used to travel with a 17" laptop, I now have a 15". There are a lot of different pockets, I haven't quite figured out where all my stuff should go. This is tsa friendly. I haven't had any trouble sending the bag with the laptop thru the checkpoint. Compared to the bag I had previously, a skooba tsa friendly backpack (which they don't make anymore), this bag seems a little heavier. I don't know if it's that hard panel at the top that give me this impression. But when I wear it it is. Dry comfortable and doesn't seem as heavy.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Smaller Than It Should Be
customer_reviews.text: This bag seems to be great however I am disappointed. I have had this backpack for over a year. It has held up well as I travel internationally on a regular basis. My biggest gripe is it is not large enough to easily accommodate a 17inch laptop. It will fit but there is absolutely no room to spare and often I have to fight with the zippers to get it closed. This is very frustrating. So if you are looking to purchase a backpack to use regularly with a 17 inch laptop, I would suggest you looking further than here. If you have a smaller laptop, this should do.
customer_reviews.author: Jasper Rains

customer_reviews.title: Tough, versatile, long lasting backpack.
customer_reviews.text: My first SwissGear smaller bag was purchased in 2009, and is STILL going strong! It's been washed a few times, and still I would say 90%. Amazing! So when I needed a bigger pack, SwissGear was my first and last option. Not disappointed. Lots of room, EXTREMELY well made, I pack this 40lb full all day and 2hr round trip on a motorcycle. I can't begin to tell you all the little engineering things I'm noticing that will make this pack last a very long time. I've modified my required configuration a few times, and the pack accommodates the changes with ease. Very versatile.
customer_reviews.author: crforfreedom

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to replace one that is too small for my HP 17" laptop (and is showing its wear after nine or so years). This bookbag is comfortable and fits my laptop perfectly. It does have the TSA lay down sleeve (although I have not used it because I precheck). It is somewhat weirdly shaped because it is so tall, but I have traveled three times with it and had no problems getting it in the overhead on the plane and it has traveled through several airports well. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: T. Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Once you buy swissgear you don't buy anything else
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack because I previously owned a smaller swissgear that lasted from high school to law school, that is from 2002-2016. I was searching for a backpack that could hold my 15.6 laptop and other stuff like food, purse, clothes, ipad, etc because I travel alot for school and work and always carry a lunchbox because of my special food diet. This backpack can hold alot of things and its great for school, work, travel etc. Its very secure and sturdy, a lot of compartments. Currently it has really done its job with 2 summers in university of california, 1 winter in new york studying for the bar exam, and 2 hurricanes (maria & irma).
customer_reviews.author: Paola Zaragoza Cardenales

customer_reviews.title: SwissGear Superiority
customer_reviews.text: A gift for my daughter for both college and overseas travel, it makes other backpacks seem like medieval torture devices. It centers heavy books wonderfully, has a organizational structure that's not random, many little surprise handy things throughout...too many to mention. Wonderful 'fold out' for airport security. Great quality, solid, and stylish as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but heavy
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very well built backpack and I’m sure it will last a long time. Two things I didn’t like: it’s heavy. Even when it’s completely empty it still weighs quite a bit. Another thing is that the zippers clink like crazy. It sounds like a silly thing to complain about but it can be very annoying when say, the backpack is sitting next to you in a car. I would recommend this backpack if you have to wear it on you a lot because it has a lot of padding and it is very comfortable on your back.
customer_reviews.author: Camille V.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, LOTS of pockets
customer_reviews.text: I really like this backpack. It is sturdy and looks nice at a fraction of the cost of other similar products. It has a dizzying number of pockets, some of which I am still discovering. If I have any complaint, it is the lack of a user manual to provide examples of what goes where.
customer_reviews.author: Doug (dmartin)

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this bag.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is so nice. I rarely spend this much money on bags, but I have always appreciated the quality of other SwissGear items I have purchased. This bag doesn't disappoint. It's wonderfully durable, feels great, has the finest quality zippers and best of all, my 17" HP Envy slips right in with an inch or two to spare (however, my 17.5" Alienware beast - 17 R4 - won't even allow the zipper to close). That's fine, though - the Alienware is too heavy to want to carry on my back anyway. This bag might last me 1
customer_reviews.author: Ring

customer_reviews.title: Best packpack
customer_reviews.text: Best backpack there is. I use this backpack mostly for college and it holds everything. I wanted a backpack with alot of extra pockets and extra space, and one that could also carry my laptop. This backpack was the largest I could find for my laptop, and it has a bunch of pockets and space.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke after a week.
customer_reviews.text: I am so bummed this was cheaply made because I really needed a backpack for work purposes. After a week, the zipper broke and would no longer function. Overall, it appears low quality and the sellers do not seem to care about their customers. Be careful!
customer_reviews.author: Chad C

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but heavy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack time ago for my husband that travels a lot for work. I love that it is very sturdy, well made, has a lot of pockets and everything he needs for traveling and going to work. The only negative is that it is heavy, even empty. So personally I would not use it, but I think he likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Kla

customer_reviews.title: Back pack capacity
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bc my other Swiss Gear back pack needed to be replaced. An important zipper suddenly broke. I load it up pretty good for work and even travel. I’m not sure if this one has as much capacity but I guess for my health I shouldn’t carry so much and too much stuff can cause damage to the back pack. I just hate carrying more bags. I hope the zippers work great. The compartments are different than my other one.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: A review: this backpack 8 years later
customer_reviews.text: Can’t say enough about this backpack. I’ve had it almost 10 years now and it still holds up perfectly. Great for carrying your laptop and other electronics. This went with me to college, overseas, camping trips & moving across the country twice. I still have yet to run into any problems with it. No broken zippers, no broken straps, looks great, carries a lot and feels great. Buy this backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ...but the zippers do "jangle" a lot when moving
customer_reviews.text: I picked this based on some review and did not review any details... It did it's job for TSA inspection xrays. Only problem I had was remembering where I put my items... lots of pockets and zippers. It was easier than my formal office computer leather bag. An improvement could be quieter zippers. They bang to together and make too much noise... you can't be a stealth ninja. Perhaps coat the zippers with silicon rubber.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse C

customer_reviews.title: Well made bag under $100
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Dad for Christmas. He travels a lot and is always on the go. I wanted to find a well made bag under $100 because he has quite the talent for blowing through backpacks, messenger bags, luggage etc. etc. It has been a few months and this backpack has held up! Believe it or not, his favorite part is the handle. It's super sturdy and has withstood the daily use of a someone who often prefers to carry a backpack rather than wearing it. He also appreciates the organized storage space and pockets. It has really cut down on the number of times he misplaces his boarding pass. Overall, a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like the previous version of the same model
customer_reviews.text: I used to have this very same model of SwissGear bag for years - superlite, very practical, easy fit under the airline seats, great internal volume for such a small bag. This updated version is much worse designed, has all sorts of belts hanging around it, ready to be caught and stuck by any external source, much heavier and more rigid. To make things worse eBag that sold it, charges $9 for restock and UPS store charges another $12 for shipping. Do NOT trust their allegedly "free" shipping ad, it's free one way only. Bad purchase experience, pretty bad.
customer_reviews.author: SharkShape

customer_reviews.title: update: zipper broke. Great backpack for high schooler, I’m jealous
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my high school son and I now I’m jealous - want to get one for myself too. It’s a solid backpack, with a lot of compartments, good padding , that doesn’t fell like would fall apart anytime soon. UPDATE: zipper broke after about 5 months of high shool use. Granted, use was on the heavy side - 2.5miles walking 5 times a week (no bus) with bag full of books, laptop, and sports gear - and thus 3 stars, rather than 1.. but i'd expect somewhat more durability.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: very sturdy and large but it is super heavy even when empty! just carrying a notebook and macbook air for a week took a toll on my back, I can't even imagine with a semester's worth of books!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable even when fully packed
customer_reviews.text: I travel on business every week of the month so this pack get used and tested. Very nice pack and easy to stay organized with all of the different zippered areas and compartments. Zippers seem sturdy and close well. The bag, when fully loaded with two computers, two cell phones, aluminum water bottle and various files, carries well and the two straps are very comfortable and are easily adjustable. I see this brand of pack being used by many people like me so I know the brand and style is a good product...highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MeeksDG

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had a usb port for a power bank but love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack and appreciate so much that the seller put up the blue one after I inquired about it. It's exactly as described and so sturdy and comfortable to wear with plenty of organization space. I'm excited to wear it for traveling. My only drawback is I would have liked a designated powerbank pocket with a usb but we can't have everything, can we? I sacrificed that for that sweet sweet tablet pocket and I regret nearly nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeroyn

customer_reviews.title: Great pack - one problem
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth or fifth Swiss Gear backpack so I obviously like them and this one is in some ways better than the ones before. I give it only four stars because the new side pouches are too shallow, and the strap does not cinch tightly enough, to secure a Nalgene or other 32 ounce bottle. This would be a perfect pack if I could transplant the deeper pouches of my previous pack onto this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Tye

customer_reviews.title: Not enough organization for me - sent it back
customer_reviews.text: I am a mobile office, working in multiple locations. I carry a laptop with mouse and power cord, 4 bottles of water, cell phone charging dongle and cord, writing utensils, headphones, lots of papers/note books, and my lunch. In my current Swiss bag, I have a zipper pouch, pen holder sleeve, velcro closed storage, stretchy mesh storage... Just lots of ways to store all the items I need for a pro back pack. Though this bag looks great and feels solid, I returned it and continue to use my 2 year old bag that has the pockets i need.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Knight

customer_reviews.title: This  backpack carries my trust
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the BEST backpack I have ever had. I own the red amd black one and purchased it for $60.43. I have used this every work day for 2.5 years and it has yet to fail me in any aspect. The zippers, fabric, straps, compartments, mesh, caliper, and stiching are still in top notch condition. I'm looking forward to a few more years out of this fantastic backpack. Bravo Swiss Grear!
customer_reviews.author: Texas KnowHow

customer_reviews.title: Best Backpack i Have Owned
customer_reviews.text: Bought this backpack on a friend's recommendation..this is the best backpack I have ever owned. I have been using for the last week for work and even though I am carrying a heavy laptop, lunch and various items it is so comfortable to carry. I am a person that doesn't like to spend a lot of money on anything, however this is worth every penny. For work I travel to different office locations, the backpack is my mobile office.
customer_reviews.author: twallingaz

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I use it for commuting on the light rail downtown to work. I like the laptop carrier feature because I often take my laptop home. The pockets are fairly easy access. I guess my primary complaint would he that the zippers are a little loose...they stay shut but they are easy to open when you have to worry about pick pockets. Also, it isn't the most stylish bag, but it does get the job done. A 4 star bag just not a 5 star WOW.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance of everything I need.
customer_reviews.text: It seems like every backpack is tiny these days. Not this guy. Fits my 15” work laptop comfortably, along with a sizable wireless keyboard for when I’m traveling. Plenty of room for storage and good dedicated pockets for storing smaller items. It’s also not so big that I feel dumb wearing it - size is just right. Provides what I’ve come to expect from the brand: durable, comfortable, no frills, no fuss. Just a solid workhorse of a backpack. My previous backpack lasted me 8 years. No reason to believe this one won’t achieve the same. Solid, sturdy - I really love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I've had the bag for over a year and it works well. But I have to slide the TSA zippers down to the bottom because I still try to use them to open the bag—the main zippers aren't always visible from the top view. My next bag (likely still Swiss Gear) will have better divider options—this one feels like two big pockets where things just bounce around. Could be the perfect bag while actively traveling but not so great for my day-to-day needs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice bag, it has tons of pockets for every conceivable personal device, always easy to access. Can hold my laptop, mouse and full length keyboard for travel to and from the office. I'm using it to commute to work and wanted a bag I could wear on my back securely since I work in a downtown setting and bag snatching is not unknown there. The bag is very rugged, well made and looks like it will last a very long time. I would also use this for travel or hiking as well as it has a lot of space for extra food and water.
customer_reviews.author: AgentK

customer_reviews.title: Great bag if you are looking for lots of room!
customer_reviews.text: I travel quite a bit for work and with my family. This backpack works great for me. I will say if you put it under the carry on seat storage on a flight it is a bit wide. I say this because I usually travel with a water bottle in the side pocket. I now have to remove the bottle and place it in one of the main compartments of the bag, when I get to my seat on the flight. But the additional room compared to other styles, outweighs this issue for me. I couldn't be more happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ahalley

customer_reviews.title: Good bag but ScanSmart not so smart
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a well-made, smartly-designed bag, but understand that the ScanSmart system is not compatible with many security systems: the bag when unfolded in two either won’t fit in the bins or TSA will not allow the tablet side since there are items under it. I went through security and was confronted with this problem and had to take my laptop and tablet out. I spoke with 2 TSA agents who confirmed this.
customer_reviews.author: eattrig

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy for Business Travel
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this back pack! I'm very please with all of the space. The provided pockets for different items is amazing. I don't use the TSA feature simply because they usually make you pull your laptop out anyway so that's and xtra pocket for me. The larger front pocket is the "never ending pocket"! I packed for a 3 day business trip... clothes, shoes, belt, hygiene items, note book, laptop, other electrionic items, and snacks comfortable in this backpack. With room to spare. It's been on 3 trips with me so far and I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: LS2016

customer_reviews.title: love
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. I think the black and white is sharp. Has so many compartments I actually forget how much crap I have in it. The only thing that could be a downside for more petite folks is the length of this bag. It hangs just slightly past my waist, lower than any bag I've had before, and it kind of prevents me from standing straight when fully loaded. It's a very large bag!
customer_reviews.author: Foo

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Computer backpack, great for on the road travel and everyday BUT see update.
customer_reviews.text: I am required to keep my computer with me on the road and from office to home everyday. This thing gets a workout. I bought this one because I had a previous version before and it had been to several countries and on more plane travel than I care to count. Finally just started to wear out the back and bottom, but no complaints. Lasted many years more than I expected. Hoping this one will do the same. 2 month update: I had same model I used for years until the bottom started coming apart, no complaints with that, so I got this one as replacement. Already have seams unraveling, very disappoint in the quality of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ramsbey

customer_reviews.title: ... for our trips that took us through airports and loved it. It was a Swiss Gear backpack as ...
customer_reviews.text: We had a backpack we used for our trips that took us through airports and loved it. It was a Swiss Gear backpack as well and was used a lot. After about 8 years it finally died. Honestly at that point it was probably a mercy for the poor thing. It was such a great bag that we wanted to get another Swiss Gear bag as a replacement and I'm glad we did. This bag is perfect for traveling. The Scansmart feature makes breezing through TSA security a...well...a breeze. It's well made and well organized. I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: Ultimately too big for a carryon
customer_reviews.text: We planned to use this bag as our carry on but after we filled the compartments it was clear it was too big to go under the seat in front of you. And, it was kind of awkward and uncomfortable to wear. My partner and I are both 5'7" - perhaps if you were taller it would sit well. Like other reviews we were really annoyed with all of the compartments. And, the zippers are very large and clunky. Overall, it just felt like there was too much going on. The lay-flat function works exactly as described and would have been really convenient had we used this on our flight.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Stoutenburgh

customer_reviews.title: Terrible zipper quality.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly a week after the return window closed for the item, the zipper for the main computer compartment broke. The zipper is unrepairable because the teeth have separated from the nylon material that they are mounted to. I now have heard seveal stories about the SwissGear zippers having problems breaking. Time to try a new brand.
customer_reviews.author: Baird B. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent bag. I just got this and I love it. I recently purchased the north face recon backpack and though I liked it, what I hated about it is the very hard and kinda bent back padding for the laptop pocket; it was very very hard and kinda bent !! and would not adjust for me at all. and it made the bag fall constantly or flip forward which I HATE. This one does have that issue at all. it big enough to fit all of my stuff and my MacBook Pro and just sits without support so smoothly !! and it has a lot of pockets. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: JJ

product_meta.title: SWISSGEAR 1900 ScanSmart TSA Laptop Backpack- Red/Black
product_meta.description: Size:19"| Color:Black/RedPack all of your gear and then some in this extra-roomy, full-featured laptop backpack. The Swissgear 1900 ScanSmart Laptop Backpack is made from durable 1200D ballistic polyester fabric and is equipped with a large opening main compartment with rugged oversize zippers, adjustable side compression straps, a heavily padded back panel with Airflow ventilation technology, padded contour shaped shoulder straps with mesh fabric and built-in suspension as well as ScanSmart lay-flat technology for the ultimate in laptop-in-case TSA scanning for most portable computers up to 17” in size. Other features built into the case include a dedicated floating TabletSafe tablet pocket, an accordion file holder, an organizer compartment, multiple internal accessory pockets, side accessory and water bottle pockets, a padded media pocket with headphone cord port, a molded top handle, a webbing daisy chain and carabiner to attach gear to when you’re on the go, a front quick-access pocket and reflective accent material built into the shoulder straps for added safety when out at night.
feature_bullets: SUPERIOR QUALITY: Made with durable, weather-resistant 1200D ballistic polyester to withstand heavy use and harsh conditions
TRAVEL WITH EASE: ScanSmart lay-flat technology protects up to a 17" laptop, opens quickly at airport security, and ensures a hassle-free laptop-in-bag TSA scan

ORGANIZED & SPACIOUS: Easy access laptop and iPad compartment separate with front organizational pocket for all of your writing utensils, pocket notebooks, and keys. Front, large, U-zip pocket for quick access essentials. Two, breathable, side compartments for an umbrella, oversize water bottle, or a change of clothes.
COMFORTABLE: Contoured shoulder straps with mesh fabric and adjustable side compression straps. Padded back panel with Airflow ventilation technology for added support and comfort.
DIMENSIONS: Exterior — 18.5" x 13.5" x 9"; Laptop Compartment — 14.5" x 11" x 1.5"; Tablet Pocket Capacity — 10" x 7"; Bag volume — 31 L

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars11,976 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
